summary: Tested MegaRadio UI/UX improvements after cache clear. Tab bar now correctly shows 4 tabs (Discover, Genres, Favorites, Profile) with Records hidden. Guest User Profile settings page now shows Language, Country, Account options. Discoverable genres banner text alignment issue noted (centered, not right-aligned as specified in styles). Favorites List/Grid toggle UI exists but could not fully test without favorites data.

ui_bugs.issue: Text is centered/left aligned in web preview instead of right-aligned as specified in styles (alignItems: 'flex-end', textAlign: 'right'). This may be a React Native Web rendering difference.

issues: Text 'Folk music' and 'Discover all the stations' appear centered/left in web preview. Style specifies right alignment but web rendering shows different result. May need explicit width and right positioning for web compatibility.

action_items: CRITICAL: Genres tab navigation to genre-detail could not be verified due to no genre items having data-testid in web preview
MEDIUM: Discoverable genres banner text alignment - verify in native app (iOS/Android) as web preview may render differently
LOW: Favorites List/Grid toggle - verified UI elements exist (sort-btn, view-mode-grid, view-mode-list) but needs favorites data to fully test functionality
critical_code_review_comments: Tab bar configuration is correct - Records has href: null, Genres tab is properly configured
Guest User Profile settings implementation is correct with Language, Country, Account options
Discoverable genres banner styling has correct CSS (alignItems: 'flex-end', textAlign: 'right') but React Native Web may render differently than native apps
Favorites page has correct sort options (Newest, Oldest, A-Z, Z-A, Custom) and view mode toggle (Grid/List)

success_rate.frontend: 80% - Tab bar fixed (was broken before cache clear), Guest Profile settings working, Discoverable genres alignment may have web-specific rendering issue

context_for_next_testing_agent: Tab bar was fixed after clearing Metro cache (rm -rf .metro-cache). Discoverable genres banner text alignment should be verified in native app as web preview may have rendering differences.

guest_user_profile_settings.details: Guest User label, Settings section, Language, Country, Account options all visible and working

favorites_sorting.details: Sort options (Newest, Oldest, A-Z, Z-A, Custom order) visible in modal but cannot test actual sorting without data

genre_navigation_to_detail.details: Genres tab works but genre items did not have data-testid in web preview. Code shows correct navigation to /genre-detail page.

notes: After clearing Metro cache (rm -rf .metro-cache && sudo supervisorctl restart expo), tab bar started showing correctly. This suggests the previous issues were due to stale cache. The discoverable genres banner alignment issue may be a React Native Web specific rendering difference - should be verified in actual iOS/Android app.
